p: Another important progressive biomarker of AD is the serum amyloid P component (SAP) which is produced in the liver and localized in the brain. SAP is a neurotoxic agent that, through binding to fibrils, protects Aβ from proteolysis. With disease progression, more cytokines and acute-phase proteins are released and, thus, more Aβ fibrils will be deposited ( 57, 58).
